name: lapsi
description: A sour fruit native to Nepal, often made into pickles, candies, and titaura.

name: aam (mango)
description: A juicy tropical fruit popular in Nepal, enjoyed raw or in juices during summer.

name: naspati (Asian pear)
description: A crisp and juicy fruit that is shaped like a pear but has the texture of an apple.

name: kagati (Nepali lemon)
description: A small, round lemon with strong sourness, commonly used in Nepali cuisine and drinks.

name: anar (pomegranate)
description: A red fruit with juicy seeds, known for its sweetness and health benefits.

name: amala (Indian gooseberry)
description: A small green fruit rich in Vitamin C, used in pickles and Ayurvedic medicine.

name: bel (wood apple)
description: A hard-shelled fruit used to make a traditional cooling drink in summer.

name: rukh katahar (jackfruit)
description: A large tropical fruit with a sweet, fibrous flesh often eaten fresh or cooked.

name: bhuin katahar (breadfruit)
description: A starchy fruit eaten cooked, similar in texture to potatoes or yam.

name: tamarind (imli)
description: A sour, tangy fruit used in chutneys, snacks, and traditional Nepali dishes.
